abstract.text: A template that provides information for a point of interest, food order, parking location, or charging location.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: An information template displays a list of items, and up to three actions the user can perform.

You use an information template to display informative, actionable content to the user. For example, you might display a summary of the user’s food order, and provide actions to place or cancel the order.
When creating an information template, you populate the list with an array of
objects, and provide any contextual actions as an array of
objects. The template then arranges the list’s items using your choice of layout — see
To display an information template, call your interface controller’s
method to push it onto the navigation hierarchy, or
in apps with the audio entitlement.

abstract.text: Integrate CarPlay in apps related to audio, communication, navigation, parking, EV charging, food ordering, and more.
The methods that templates use to provide buttons for the navigation bar.
A data object that provides content for an information template.
A data object that provides rated content for an information template.
A template that provides information for a point of interest, food order, parking location, or charging location.
The actions that the template displays.
Creates an information template that displays the provided items using the chosen layout.
The items that the template displays.
The layout that the template uses to arrange its items.
The template’s title.
The layout that an information template uses to arrange its items.
Presents a template modally.
Adds the specified template to the navigation hierarchy and displays it.
A template that displays a map with selectable points of interest.
An abstract base class for interface templates.
A button that displays a stylized title.
Configure your food-ordering app to work with CarPlay.

doc://com.apple.carplay/documentation/Ca.title: Integrating CarPlay with your quick-ordering app

abstract.text: A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
